item.title: 5 Poems – by Daniel Bennett
item.description: _The poems below might not have kept Bennett’s original indentations. For the PDF, click this link. _ Plantation House Lazy heat on the veranda. Slow crawl of days. Time ripples like white veins through red marble. The ceiling fan slaps a devil mask in beating shadows. The man reads a two-day-old Financial Times, taps ash from a cheroot. The woman wears a white dress and straw hat,
